EPISTLE XVIII.

This epistle contains the advice of Horace to Lollius, a young gentleman in whose happiness our poet took much interest, and who was yet inexperieneed in the wiles and temptations of a courtier's life. He had already written one letter to him to guard him against some mistakes that might be fatal to his virtue. ’
